title: How to View Your Web Browser History

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's a red, yellow, green, and blue circular icon. If needed, you can download Google Chrome .

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This option is in the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Select History.
steps.content: Select History . You'll see this option near the top of the drop-down menu. Selecting it will prompt a pop-out menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . It's at the top of the pop-out menu. Doing so will take you to your search history. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. You can scroll down through your browsing history to see items from earlier in your history, or you can click a link to re-open its page. To clear your browsing history, click Clear browsing data on the left side of the page, make sure "Browsing history" is checked, and click Clear data . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. It's a blue, compass-shaped app in your Mac's dock. If needed, you can update Safari.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . This menu item is in the top-left side of your Mac's screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Show History.
steps.content: Click Show History . Doing so will bring up a window with your Mac's history. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. Clicking on an item will take you to its page. To clear your Mac's Safari history, click Safari , click Clear History... , select a time frame, and click Clear History . [6] X Research source You can also change Safari's start page .

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. It's a blue globe with an orange fox wrapped around it. If needed, you can download Mozilla Firefox .

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This option is in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu to appear. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . This will open a new drop-down menu with quick access to your history. [8] X Research source Alternatively, you can press CTRL + H to reach History .

steps.title: On the bottom of the drop-down menu, click Manage history.
steps.content: On the bottom of the drop-down menu, click Manage history . A new window will open with your entire browser history. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Review your history.
steps.content: Review your history. Double-clicking a search term will open it in your Firefox browser. You can delete history items (e.g., specific sites or entire folders) by right-clicking and clicking Delete Page(s) .

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's a white app with the Chrome icon on it.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the screen. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . It's near the middle of the menu. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. Tapping a history item will take you to its page. To clear your browsing history, tap Clear Browsing Data... in the bottom-left corner (or at the top of the page on Android), make sure "Browsing History" is checked, and tap Clear Browsing Data (or CLEAR DATA on Android) twice.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. It's a white app with a blue compass icon on it.

steps.title: Tap the book button.
steps.content: Tap the book button. It's to the left of the two overlapping squares in the lower-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the "History" tab.
steps.content: Tap the "History" tab. This clock-shaped icon is in the top-right corner of the screen. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. Tapping an entry on this page will take you to the entry's webpage. To remove items from your browsing history, tap Clear in the bottom-right corner of the screen, then select a time frame when prompted. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. This app is blue with a white "e" icon. Microsoft Edge is the default browser for Windows. If needed, you can download Microsoft Edge .

steps.title: In the top right, click ••• .
steps.content: In the top right, click ••• . This will open Settings and more . [14] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . This will have an icon of a clock with a rewind circle. Alternatively, you can press CTRL + H to reach History . You'll be able to see your most recent history in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: For more history, click ••• .
steps.content: For more history, click ••• . [15] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Open history page.
steps.content: Click Open history page . This will open a new tab with your entire browser history.

steps.title: Review your browsing history.
steps.content: Review your browsing history. You can click an item here to visit its page. You can use the search bar to find specific websites or Filter by date . To clear your browsing history, click Clear browsing data above your listed history. [16] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Check off all options you want cleared, then click Clear now .

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. It's the blue globe with an orange fox icon.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is in the bottom-right corner of the screen. A pop-up window will appear. [17] X Research source On Android, tap ⋮ in the top-right corner of the screen to prompt a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . It's in the menu. Doing so opens your Firefox mobile history page. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Review your Firefox history.
steps.content: Review your Firefox history. Tapping an item will open it in Firefox, while swiping left over an item will remove it from your browsing history. To clear your entire Firefox history, tap the trash can icon in the bottom left corner. You can choose to delete: Today , Today and Yesterday , or Everything .
